December 26, 1993: Fiction
SLOW WALTZ IN CEDAR BEND, by Robert James Waller. (Warner, $16.95.)
From Iowa to India: the romance of a professor and a colleague's wife.
THE BRIDGES OF MADISON COUNTY, by Robert James Waller. (Warner,
$16.95.) A photographer and a lonely farmer's wife in Iowa.
NIGHTMARES & DREAMSCAPES, by Stephen King. (Viking, $27.50.) Twenty
stories (mostly about the macabre), a teleplay, an essay and a poem.
WITHOUT REMORSE, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $24.95.) John Kelly becomes
involved in a Pentagon project to rescue prisoners held in North Vietnam.
THE HOPE, by Herman Wouk. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) The story of Israel from the
war of independence, in 1948, to the 1967 war.
THE CLIENT, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $23.50.) A deadly secret, revealed
by a lawyer just before he kills himself, presents problems for an 11-year-old boy.
THE BOOK OF GUYS, by Garrison Keillor. (Viking, $22.) A collection of stories
about American men and the strains of contemporary life.
LIKE WATER FOR CHOCOLATE, by Laura Esquivel. (Doubleday, $17.50.)
Frustration, love, hope -- and recipes -- sampled by a woman on a Mexican ranch.
LASHER, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $25.) The demon Lasher pursues the witch
Rowan and their child; a sequel to "The Witching Hour."
MR. MURDER, by Dean Koontz. (Putnam, $23.95.) A mystery writer's happy
family life is endangered by a madman determined to kill him and take his place.
A DANGEROUS FORTUNE, by Ken Follett. (Delacorte, $23.95.) A young
student's mysterious drowning has repercussions in Victorian England's high
society.
THE TRUCE AT BAKURA, by Kathy Tyers. (Spectra/Bantam, $21.95.) The "Star
Wars" Rebel Alliance responds to a call for help from a threatened outpost.
THE ROBBER BRIDE, by Margaret Atwood. (Talese/Doubleday, $23.50.) A
woman who long manipulated three friends suddenly reappears in their lives.
VANISHED, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $23.95.) The abduction of their young
son creates a crisis for a New York man and woman and for the woman's first
lover.
SACRED CLOWNS, by Tony Hillerman. (HarperCollins, $23.) Two Navajo tribal
policemen undertake to unravel a web of politics and murder.
December 26, 1993
Non-Fiction
SEE, I TOLD YOU SO, by Rush H. Limbaugh 3d. (Pocket, $24.) More comments
on the state of the nation by the talk show host.
PRIVATE PARTS, by Howard Stern. (Simon & Schuster, $23.) The memoirs of the
radio and television personality.
SEINLANGUAGE, by Jerry Seinfeld. (Bantam, $19.95.) Observations on life's
pleasures and ordeals by the star of the television show "Seinfeld."
THE HIDDEN LIFE OF DOGS, by Elizabeth Marshall Thomas. (Davison/Houghton
Mifflin, $18.95.) An analysis of canine behavior.
WOULDN'T TAKE NOTHING FOR MY JOURNEY NOW, by Maya Angelou.
(Random House, $17.) Essays about life and death, good and evil.
HAVING OUR SAY, by Sarah and A. Elizabeth Delany with Amy Hill Hearth.
(Kodansha, $20.) Two black sisters, both of them over 100, reflect on their lives.
EMBRACED BY THE LIGHT, by Betty J. Eadie with Curtis Taylor. (Gold Leaf
Press, $14.95.) A woman's near-death experience.
A MARRIAGE MADE IN HEAVEN ... OR TOO TIRED FOR AN AFFAIR, by Erma
Bombeck. (HarperCollins, $20.) Thoughts on 43 years of marriage.
LOVE CAN BUILD A BRIDGE, by Naomi Judd. (Villard, $24.) The country singer's
memoirs.
THE BEST CAT EVER, by Cleveland Amory. (Little, Brown, $19.95.) A third
volume about the trials and tribulations of the feline Polar Bear and his owner.
FURTHER ALONG THE ROAD LESS TRAVELED, by M. Scott Peck. (Simon &
Schuster, $21.) Discussions of love, self-esteem, relationships and spiritual
growth.
STAR TREK MEMORIES, by William Shatner with Chris Kreski. (HarperCollins,
$22.) Reminiscences from the man who played Capt. James Tiberius Kirk.
THE BOOK OF VIRTUES, by William J. Bennett. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
Moral stories adapted from the Greeks, the Bible, American folklore and other
sources.
WOMEN WHO RUN WITH THE WOLVES, by Clarissa Pinkola Estes. (Ballantine,
$23.) How myths and folk tales can enable women to understand their psyches.
THE DOWNING STREET YEARS, by Margaret Thatcher. (HarperCollins, $30.)
The former British Prime Minister recalls her 11 1/2 years in power.
